description: On April 22, the Fijian Ministry of Health and Medical Services released a PR strongly advising all health providers in Fiji to cease offering IgM/IgG rapid tests for the diagnosis of COVID-19. Fiji's sprawling, bustling capital, Suva, went into lockdown this morning tomorrow after two cases of Covid-19 were confirmed in the city.

The nationwide curfew in Fiji that is scheduled daily from 11pm to 4am still remains, Prime Minister Voreqe Bainimarama told Parliament today.

He added large gatherings and sports events were also prohibited.

description:
Fiji, 13 July 2020.
The Fijian government has announced the closure of its border to all non-Fijian citizens. Only Fijian citizens are allowed to return on repatriation flights and Fiji is not allowing any transits through it from any other country.

description:
Fiji, 27 July 2020.
Fiji's so-called "Blue Lanes" are officially open and the government says it's expecting the arrival of 100 boats to the country amid the Covid-19 pandemic.
But the requirements are strict as boat owners must first complete 14 days or longer uninterrupted at sea - this means the vessels must not stop at any other port on their way to Fiji.
Boat owners must also show proof of a negative test result for Covid-19 and everyone onboard will need to undergo screening by Fijian health officials when they are allowed through the lanes.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
New Zealand, 30 March 2020.
Fiji Airways will suspend all its domestic flights by 6pm today.
"This in line with the government's directive to stop the spread of the Covid-19 to the outer islands," the airline said.
But the airline said it is ready to assist if charter flights are required for the freight of essential supplies to the second largest island Vanua Levu and other remote areas.

description:
New Zealand, 16 April 2020.
Evacuation flights confirmed.
Meanwhile, Fijians caught in the lockdown in New Zealand and New Zealanders stranded in Fiji could now return home following Fiji Airways' announcement it would operate evacuation flights to Auckland and Nadi.
The airline said the repatriation flights would be operated on Friday.
Fiji Airways said passengers holding unused tickets between Nadi and Auckland could book themselves on the evacuation flights at no additional costs.
The government said those arriving in Nadi would be taken to a quarantine facility and monitored for 28 days.

description:
Fiji, 25 March 2020.
The Fiji government says the capital has not shut down despite the country's fourth Covid-19 case being recorded in Suva.
The country's second biggest city of Lautoka - where the first case was reported - has been in lockdown since 20 March.
However Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama said the risk of transmission in the latest Suva case was low and tracing teams were tracking down everyone who was in contact with the patient.

All other areas of Fiji continue to enforce a 23:00-04:00 curfew. Authorities are implementing heightened restrictions in the designated containment zone in Suva and Nausori. Transport controls, as well as commercial restrictions on nonessential businesses, are ongoing in the area.

Most public places in Viti Levu are closed, other than essential businesses including supermarkets and pharmacies. Nightclubs remain closed and you must abide by the nationwide curfew which need you to remain in your home or accommodation between 6pm and 4am. Many people continue to work from home given high community transmission levels. Schools remain closed and tertiary education institutions remained closed have resumed classes online.

description:
Fiji, 21 March 2020.
Individuals that have been in high-risk areas for the past 14 days or have been in contact with a COVID-19 infected individual need to be quarantined. Quarantine is used when a person is possibly infected with a disease but is not yet symptomatic. Isolation applies to patients with symptoms of infectious disease

description:
Fiji, 20 April 2020.
The Fiji Ministry of Health and Medical Services on Monday said the Fiji Government would in fact cover the costs for people who would be kept at the Government-designated quarantine facilities after their arrival in the country.
"Anyone coming into the country through the Nadi International Airport is taken to designated hotels for a 28-day quarantine period straight from the airport under the strict supervision of the health officials," it said.

description:
Fiji, 27 July 2020.
Fiji's so-called "Blue Lanes" are officially open and the government says it's expecting the arrival of 100 boats to the country amid the Covid-19 pandemic.
But the requirements are strict as boat owners must first complete 14 days or longer uninterrupted at sea - this means the vessels must not stop at any other port on their way to Fiji.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Fiji, 14 August 2020.
Fiji's health ministry says all visitors arriving in the country will continue to undergo Covid-19 tests and 14 days quarantine in a government facility.
"Nobody is eligible for quarantine in Australia and New Zealand because we have not recognized any institution. They all have to quarantine in Fiji. Quarantining in Australia and New Zealand will have to be part of ongoing negotiations so we can assign that authority to institutions we recognize."
Dr James Fong said no discussions have been held with either New Zealand or Australia on the matter.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Fiji, 4 September 2020.
Visitors to Fiji will now have to pay their quarantine costs under new Covid-19 protocols.
Parliament yesterday passed amendments to the Public Health Act to charge quarantine fees to foreigners entering Fiji during the pandemic.
